description: Asgard (Old Norse: Asgardr, meaning 'Enclosure of the Aesir') stands as the celestial stronghold of the Norse gods, positioned at the highest point of Yggdrasil, the cosmic World Tree that connects all Nine Realms. This divine fortress represents far more than a simple dwelling place for deities; it embodies the Norse conception of cosmic order, divine authority, and the heroic struggle against chaos and entropy. Unlike monotheistic concepts of heaven as an eternal paradise of peace, Asgard is fundamentally a warrior's realm - a place of feasting, preparation for battle, and the cultivation of strength needed for the prophesied final conflict of Ragnarok. The realm was constructed by the gods themselves after the primordial void of Ginnungagap gave way to creation, and its magnificent halls - from Odin's throne room Hlidskjalf to the glittering Valhalla - reflect both divine majesty and martial purpose. Asgard's temporary nature, destined to fall during Ragnarok, encapsulates the uniquely Norse philosophical outlook that courage and honor matter precisely because even the gods cannot escape fate. This realm serves as the seat of cosmic governance where the Aesir hold council, dispense justice, and maintain the delicate balance between the forces of order and the ever-threatening powers of chaos embodied by the giants and the serpent Jormungandr.

name: Norse Cosmology
features: Valhalla - Hall of the slain warriors chosen by Odin
Gladsheim - Meeting hall of the twelve Aesir
Hlidskjalf - Odin's high seat from which he surveys all realms
Idavoll - Plain where gods gather to play games
Bifrost - Rainbow bridge connecting Asgard to Midgard
Himinbjorg - Heimdall's hall at Bifrost's end

metadata.historicalPeriod: Viking Age (793-1066 CE) and earlier Germanic Iron Age traditions

richMetadata.structure: One of Nine Realms located at the top of Yggdrasil. Asgard itself is a fortress containing Aesir halls including Gladsheim, Idavoll plain, and Valhalla. Connected to other realms via Bifrost (rainbow bridge) and Yggdrasil's trunk.
inhabitants: Odin - All-Father, king of gods, god of wisdom, war, and death
Thor - Thunder god, protector of Asgard and Midgard
Freyja - Goddess of love, fertility, war, and seidr magic
Frigg - Queen of Asgard, goddess of marriage and prophecy
Tyr - God of war, justice, and heroic glory
Heimdall - Guardian of Bifrost, possessor of Gjallarhorn
Loki - Trickster god, blood-brother of Odin
Baldur - God of light, purity, and beauty
Freyr - God of fertility, prosperity, and fair weather
Valkyries - Choosers of the slain, Odin's warrior maidens
Einherjar - Honored warriors awaiting Ragnarok in Valhalla
Various servants, craftsmen, and lesser divine beings
connections: Midgard - human realm below, connected via Bifrost
Jotunheim - realm of giants, frequent source of conflict
Muspelheim - primordial fire realm of Surtr
Vanaheim - realm of the Vanir fertility gods
Svartalfheim - realm of dark elves and dwarves
Alfheim - realm of light elves, given to Freyr
Helheim - realm of the dishonorable dead, ruled by Hel
Bifrost - the burning rainbow bridge guarded by Heimdall
